00034 template <typename TYPE>
00035 class SimpleListElement
00036 {
00037     friend class SimpleList<TYPE>;
00038     friend class SimpleRecycleList<TYPE>;
00039
00040 public:
00042     SimpleListElement()
00043     {
00044         NextElement = NULL;
00045     }
00046
00048     void Init()
00049     {
00050         NextElement = NULL;
00051     }
00052
00054     virtual ~SimpleListElement();
00055
00056 private:
00057     TYPE ElementContainer;
00058     SimpleListElement<TYPE> * NextElement;
00059 };

00196 template <typename TYPE>
00197 SimpleList<TYPE>::SimpleList()
00198 {
00199     // There is nothing in the list
00200     NumberOfElements = 0;
00201     Head = NULL;
00202     Tail = NULL;
00203
00204     // There is no position at all
00205     PreviousElement = NULL;
00206     CurrentElement = NULL;
00207     RemoveCurrentHasOccured = false;
00208 }

00211 SimpleList<TYPE>::~SimpleList()
00212 {
00213     Empty();
00214 }

00216 // Access fonction
00217 template <typename TYPE>
00218 bool SimpleList<TYPE>::Add( const TYPE& Val )
00219 {
00220     SimpleListElement<TYPE> * tmp = GetNewSimpleListElement();
00221     if ( tmp == NULL ) // Plus assez de memoire
00222         return false;
00223
00224     tmp->ElementContainer = Val;
00225     if ( Head == NULL ) // La liste etait vide
00226     {
00227         Tail =  Head = tmp;
00228     }
00229     else
00230     {
00231         // Le nouveau devient le dernier
00232         Tail->NextElement = tmp;
00233         Tail = tmp;
00234
00235         //if ( Head->NextElement == NULL )
00236         //{
00237         //      Head->NextElement = tmp;
00238         //}
00239     }
00240
00241     // On incremente le nombre d'objet dans la liste
00242     NumberOfElements++;
00243
00244     // Tout est ok
00245     return true;
00246 }
00247
00252 template <typename TYPE>
00253 bool SimpleList<TYPE>::AddHead( const TYPE& Val )
00254 {
00255     SimpleListElement<TYPE> * tmp = GetNewSimpleListElement();
00256     if ( tmp == NULL ) // Plus assez de memoire
00257         return false;
00258
00259     tmp->ElementContainer = Val;
00260     if ( Head == NULL ) // La liste etait vide
00261     {
00262         Tail =  Head = tmp;
00263     }
00264     else
00265     {
00266         // Le nouveau devient le dernier
00267         // Head->NextElement = tmp;
00268         tmp->NextElement = Head;
00269         Head = tmp;
00270     }
00271
00272     // On incremente le nombre d'objet dans la liste
00273     NumberOfElements++;
00274
00275     // Tout est ok
00276     return true;
00277 }

00283 template <typename TYPE>
00284 bool SimpleList<TYPE>::AddTail( const TYPE& Val )
00285 {
00286     // just call the add function
00287     return Add(Val);
00288 }

00296 // Set position to the first element
00297 template <typename TYPE>
00298 void SimpleList<TYPE>::First()
00299 {
00300     PreviousElement = NULL;
00301     CurrentElement = Head;
00302     RemoveCurrentHasOccured = false;
00303 }
00304
00305 // Set position to the next element
00306 template <typename TYPE>
00307 bool SimpleList<TYPE>::Next()
00308 {
00309     // Ok, we do not have any other element
00310     if ( CurrentElement == NULL )
00311     {
00312         RemoveCurrentHasOccured = false;
00313         return false;
00314     }
00315
00316     //seb
00317     if ( RemoveCurrentHasOccured == true )
00318     {
00319         RemoveCurrentHasOccured = false;
00320         // Previous and Current have already the good value
00321         return true;
00322     }
00323
00324     // Here we can go forward in the list
00325     PreviousElement = CurrentElement;
00326     CurrentElement  = CurrentElement->NextElement;
00327
00328     // Have we reach the end of the list ?
00329     if ( CurrentElement == NULL )
00330     {
00331         return false;
00332     }
00333
00334     return true;
00335 }
00336
00337 // Set position to the next element
00338 template <typename TYPE>
00339 bool SimpleList<TYPE>::AtEnd() const
00340 {
00341     // Ok, we do not have any other element
00342     if ( CurrentElement == NULL )
00343         return true;
00344
00345     return false;
00346 }
00347
00348 // Set position to the next element
00349 template <typename TYPE>
00350 bool SimpleList<TYPE>::NotAtEnd() const
00351 {
00352     // Ok, we do not have any other element
00353     if ( CurrentElement != NULL )
00354         return true;
00355
00356     return false;
00357 }
00358
00359 // Get the current element of the list
00360 template <typename TYPE>
00361 TYPE& SimpleList<TYPE>::GetCurrent() const
00362 {
00363     if ( RemoveCurrentHasOccured == true )
00364     {
00365         throw SimpleListException("SimpleList<TYPE>::GetCurrent : Forbidden after a call to RemoveCurrent");
00366     }
00367
00368 #ifdef DEBUG
00369     if ( CurrentElement== NULL )
00370     {
00371         OmiscidError( "Warning :  In SimpleList<TYPE>::GetCurrent() CurrentElement == NULL\n" );
00372     }
00373 #endif
00374 
00375     return CurrentElement->ElementContainer;
00376 }
00377
00378 // Remove the current element
00379 template <typename TYPE>
00380 bool SimpleList<TYPE>::RemoveCurrent()
00381 {
00382     if ( RemoveCurrentHasOccured == true )
00383     {
00384         throw SimpleListException("SimpleList<TYPE>::RemoveCurrent : Forbidden after a previous call to RemoveCurrent");
00385     }
00386     RemoveCurrentHasOccured = true;
00387     SimpleListElement<TYPE> * tmp = CurrentElement;
00388
00389     if ( tmp == NULL )
00390     {
00391         // We must call at least First on a non empty list
00392         return false;
00393     }
00394
00395     // Here we have a current element...
00396     // Are we at the begining of the SimpleList ?
00397     if ( Head == tmp )
00398     {
00399         // Yes, wa are !
00400         Head = tmp->NextElement;
00401
00402         // PreviousElement remains the same :
00403         // PreviousElement == NULL
00404
00405         // The new current element if the next in the list, so the head
00406         CurrentElement = Head;
00407     }
00408     else
00409     {
00410         // We are not at the begining of the list
00411         // Here we can remove directly the element within the list
00412         tmp = CurrentElement;
00413         PreviousElement->NextElement = tmp->NextElement;
00414         CurrentElement = tmp->NextElement;
00415     }
00416
00417     // Was the element the last item of the list ?
00418     if ( Tail == tmp )
00419     {
00420         // We have remove the last item of the list
00421         Tail = PreviousElement;
00422     }
00423
00424     // Delete the old current element
00425     ReleaseSimpleListElement(tmp);
00426
00427     // Change the element count
00428     NumberOfElements--;
00429
00430     return true;
00431 }
00432
00433 // Remove a specific element
00434 template <typename TYPE>
00435 bool SimpleList<TYPE>::Remove(const TYPE& Element)
00436 {
00437     for( First(); NotAtEnd(); Next() )
00438     {
00439         if ( GetCurrent() == Element )
00440         {
00441             RemoveCurrent();
00442             return true;
00443         }
00444     }
00445     return false;
00446 }
00447
00448 template <typename TYPE>
00449 void SimpleList<TYPE>::Empty()
00450 {
00451     SimpleListElement<TYPE> * tmp;
00452     // On libere tous les elements de la liste
00453     while( Head != NULL )
00454     {
00455         tmp = Head;
00456         Head = Head->NextElement; // On dechaine le premier element
00457         ReleaseSimpleListElement(tmp);
00458         NumberOfElements--; // Non obligatoire !
00459     }
00460 }
00461
00462 template <typename TYPE>
00463 bool SimpleList<TYPE>::IsEmpty() const
00464 {
00465     return Head == NULL;
00466 }
00467
00468 template <typename TYPE>
00469 bool SimpleList<TYPE>::IsNotEmpty() const
00470 {
00471     return Head != NULL;
00472 }
00473
00474 template <typename TYPE>
00475 TYPE SimpleList<TYPE>::ExtractFirst()
00476 {
00477     if ( IsEmpty() == true )
00478     {
00479         throw SimpleListException("SimpleList<TYPE>::ExtractFirst : Forbidden when the list is empty");
00480     }
00481
00482     SimpleListElement<TYPE>* elt = Head;
00483     if(Head == Tail)
00484     {
00485         Head = NULL; Tail = NULL;
00486     }
00487     else
00488     {
00489         Head = elt->NextElement;
00490     }
00491     NumberOfElements--;
00492
00493     TYPE tmp = elt->ElementContainer;
00494     ReleaseSimpleListElement(elt);
00495     return tmp;
00496 }

00498 template <typename TYPE>
00499 SimpleListElement<TYPE>*  SimpleList<TYPE>::GetNewSimpleListElement() const
00500 {
00501     return new OMISCID_TLM SimpleListElement<TYPE>;
00502 }
00503
00504 template <typename TYPE>
00505 void SimpleList<TYPE>::ReleaseSimpleListElement(SimpleListElement<TYPE>* elt) const
00506 {
00507     delete elt;
00508 }

00519 template <typename TYPE>
00520 class MutexedSimpleList : public SimpleList<TYPE>, public LockableObject
00521 {
00522 public:
00523 #ifdef DEBUG_MSL
00524     MutexedSimpleList()
00525     {
00526         NbLocks = 0; // MutexedSimpleList is not lock
00527     }
00528
00529     virtual ~MutexedSimpleList()
00530     {
00531         NbLocks = 100; // MutexedSimpleList is not lock anymore,
00532         // All operation will be permitted to destroy the list
00533     }
00534
00535     bool Add( const TYPE& Val )
00536     {
00537         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00538         {
00539             fprintf( stderr, "Using Add on a non lock list.\n" );
00540         }
00541         return SimpleList<TYPE>::Add(Val);
00542     }
00543
00544     bool AddHead( const TYPE& Val )
00545     {
00546         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00547         {
00548             fprintf( stderr, "Using AddHeah on a non lock list.\n" );
00549         }
00550         return SimpleList<TYPE>::AddHead(Val);
00551     }
00552
00553     bool AddTail( const TYPE& Val )
00554     {
00555         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00556         {
00557             fprintf( stderr, "Using AddTail on a non lock list.\n" );
00558         }
00559         return SimpleList<TYPE>::AddTail(Val);
00560     }
00561
00562     unsigned int GetNumberOfElements() const
00563     {
00564         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00565         {
00566             fprintf( stderr, "Using GetNumberOfElements on a non lock list.\n" );
00567         }
00568         return SimpleList<TYPE>::GetNumberOfElements();
00569     }
00570
00571     void First()
00572     {
00573         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00574         {
00575             fprintf( stderr, "Using First on a non lock list.\n" );
00576         }
00577         SimpleList<TYPE>::First();
00578     }
00579
00580     bool Next()
00581     {
00582         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00583         {
00584             fprintf( stderr, "Using Next on a non lock list.\n" );
00585         }
00586         return SimpleList<TYPE>::Next();
00587     }
00588
00589     bool AtEnd() const
00590     {
00591         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00592         {
00593             fprintf( stderr, "Using AtEnd on a non lock list.\n" );
00594         }
00595         return SimpleList<TYPE>::AtEnd();
00596     }
00597
00598     bool NotAtEnd() const
00599     {
00600         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00601         {
00602             fprintf( stderr, "Using NotAtEnd on a non lock list.\n" );
00603         }
00604         return SimpleList<TYPE>::NotAtEnd();
00605     }
00606
00607     TYPE& GetCurrent() const
00608     {
00609         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00610         {
00611             fprintf( stderr, "Using GetCurrent on a non lock list.\n" );
00612         }
00613         return SimpleList<TYPE>::GetCurrent();
00614     }
00615

00617     {
00618         if ( NbLocks == 0 )

00623     }
00624
00625     bool IsEmpty() const
00626     {
00627         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00628         {
00629             fprintf( stderr, "Using IsEmpty on a non lock list.\n" );
00630         }
00631         return SimpleList<TYPE>::IsEmpty();
00632     }
00633
00634     bool IsNotEmpty() const
00635     {
00636         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00637         {
00638             fprintf( stderr, "Using IsNotEmpty on a non lock list.\n" );

00641     }

00650     }

00659     }
00660
00661     virtual void Empty()
00662     {
00663         if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00664         {
00665             fprintf( stderr, "Using Empty on a non lock list.\n" );
00666         }
00667         SimpleList<TYPE>::Empty();
00668     }

00670 private:
00671     AtomicReentrantCounter NbLocks;
00672 #else
00673 public:
00674     virtual ~MutexedSimpleList()
00675     {
00676     }
00677 #endif

00697
00698 template <typename TYPE>
00699 bool MutexedSimpleList<TYPE>::Lock()
00700 {
00701 #ifdef DEBUG_MSL
00702     // Only for MutexedSimpleList debugging
00703     bool ret = mutex.Lock();    // Add SL_ as comment in order to prevent false alarm in code checker on locks
00704
00705     if ( ret == true )
00706     {
00707         NbLocks++;
00708     }
00709     return ret;
00710 #else
00711     return mutex.Lock();        // Add SL_ as comment in order to prevent false alarm in code checker on locks
00712 #endif
00713 }
00714
00715 template <typename TYPE>
00716 bool MutexedSimpleList<TYPE>::Unlock()
00717 {
00718 #ifdef DEBUG_MSL
00719     if ( NbLocks == 0 )
00720     {
00721         OmiscidTrace( "List already unlock. something goes wrong ?" );
00722     }
00723
00724     // Only for MutexedSimpleList debugging
00725     bool ret = mutex.Unlock();  // Add SL_ as comment in order to prevent false alarm in code checker on locks
00726
00727     if ( ret == true && NbLocks > 0)
00728     {
00729         NbLocks++;
00730     }
00731     return ret;
00732 #else
00733     return mutex.Unlock();      // Add SL_ as comment in order to prevent false alarm in code checker on locks
00734 #endif
00735 }
